oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Forms of Salutation used by Bushmen. By /han=kasso (L VIII.-32. 8853-8857, 8852 rev.). Men and women as well as the young and the old greet in different ways. There are expressions for saluting one another (called kuanna-i), and greetings made by people who are comfortable or not (and avoid saluting one another). 1) p.8853v: an example of a salutation or kuanna-i (a greeting), 2) This story is found in Book VIII-32.
